description: All content with the node type

details.description:
Learning & Networking Node

CodeTheCity is a civic, codesign and hacking initiative committed to building a better community through hack weekends, open data, workshops, and idea generation tools.

The Aberdeen Node will run codesign, and information workshops, as well as civic, codesign hack events across Scotland to promote learning and use of open data.

We will also be setting up premises in the near future to provide collaborative working space for people and companies interested in learning about and using open data to drive innovation and create more dynamic communities.

To learn more about ODI Aberdeen visit their website.

Learning Node

We aim to champion Open Data education in our ecosystem. It is founded by iSpace foundation, Founded in 2013, we exist to nourish and flourish the startup ecosystem in Accra. We are a co-working space for everything innovation – and innovation in its truest form, not the jargon.

Our mission is to provide guidance to startups working on Open Data projects. Our focus is to train a lot more people on Open Data in the areas of research, programming and data analytics while making money - to ensure sustainability.

By building and training many people in Open data in the ecosystem, we will be able to get more people the tools and resources to build their own projects. We want to grow a network of open data projects in our region since we believe that Open Data can help many new startups and enhance processes of existing ones as well.

To learn more about ODI Accra visit their website.

Learning Node

Iniciativa Barcelona is the hub for open data in the region. We are a non-profit organisation focused on providing training and leveraging projects related to open data. Our ambitions are to support local entrepreneurship and conduct research in the field of open data.

Open data advocacy is a global movement and joining the ODI Node Network enables us to enhance our efforts to support this movement and to connect local members to a global network.

As ODI Barcelona we want to bring together public administration, industry and the community (open data advocates) in order to leverage shared projects. We will:

  • convene and connect people through local events
  • deliver training to help understanding and practical use of open data (particularly public administration)
  • communicate stories that demonstrate the local impact of open data

We would like to collaborate with our local community and advisory board to help develop ODI Barcelona's local activities.

To learn more about ODI Barcelona visit their website.

Learning & Network node

NICVA support and represent voluntary and community organisations across Northern Ireland.

With over 1,100 members, ranging from household-name charities to grassroots community groups, we lobby and campaign to advance the interests of the people and communities our members support.

We offer a wide range of practical services, products and support to our members to help them do what they do best: find innovative solutions for social challenges.

To learn more about ODI Belfast visit their website.

Learning & Network Node

Innovation Birmingham (formerly Aston Science Park) was founded in 1982 and is the UK’s third oldest science park. Located in an urban setting within central Birmingham, Innovation Birmingham is wholly owned by Birmingham City Council.

Innovation Birmingham Campus is the base for Birmingham’s tech community. The Innovation Birmingham team is actively looking to work with and bring together the public and private sectors. It is a one-stop-shop for innovators, entrepreneurs and investors looking to develop or fund tech startups with high growth potential.

The campus facilities include the Entrepreneurs for the Future (e4f) multi-occupancy centre, hot-desking facilities and a wide range of flexible office units. However, the campus is far from just bricks and mortar: the team actively nurtures an interactive and supportive community within the place. The Campus strategy is about creating a wide range of valuable opportunities, providing the missing aspects of a successful business puzzle and helping innovators and tech entrepreneurs to succeed.

ODI Birmingham are committed to delivering the following:

  • Building an awareness of the ODI and open data to the city's tech community. This will be done using existing meet ups and a Friday lectures series.
  • Supporting large organisations within the transport, health and sustainability areas to publish open data sets.
  • Running data visualisation workshops using various tools, techniques and data sources.
  • Drawing challenges out of transport and health organisations through open data and creating solutions with open data.
  • Engaging public and third sector organisations in the use of open data.
  • Leveraging various funded projects to deliver aspects of open data training to stimulate demand for ODI training and membership.

To learn more about ODI Birmingham visit their website.

Community Node

uGov is a nonprofit social enterprise that promotes new services, increases the openness of government data and supports the development of new business - introducing new ways that citizens can interact with Government.

We believe in the power of data to promote innovation and bring positive change to people's lives in Brazil.

Unleashing this power has become a key part of our job as uGov, ubiquitous Government. We have joined forces with ODI and the Network to develop a node in Brazil's capital to support this mission.

To learn more about ODI Brasilia visit their website.

Network node

Bristol Is Open is a joint venture between the University of Bristol and Bristol City Council. It is funded by the local, national and European governments, with academic research funding, and by the private sector. It is delivering research and development initiatives that contribute to the development of a smart city and the Internet of Things.

To learn more about ODI Bristol visit their website.

Learning node

The Software Engineering Competence Center (SECC) is a leading Egyptian ICT governmental organisation established in 2001. SECC aims at bridging the gap between the technologies needed to overcome the economic, social and environmental challenges and the current existing technologies.

In 2005, SECC was merged into the Information Technology Industry Development Agency (ITIDA). ITIDA is a governmental organisation developing the IT industry in Egypt. It is significantly financed by the private ICT sector with notable presence of private ICT business representatives on its board of directors.

To learn more about ODI Cairo visit their website.

Community Node

The Satori Lab helps organisations transition effectively from the industrial age to the connected age. They do this by refreshing outdated thinking, unshackling staff so they can realise their full potential, and developing happy, agile company cultures that foster effective innovation. They provide strategic advice and we design and facilitate in-house learning programmes and staff events.

To learn more about ODI Cardiff visit their website.

Community Node

Visceral Business focus on combining people and data together to help organisations and ecosystems develop integrated skills and capabilities so they can address mission-critical business challenges quickly. They specialise in creative effective, peer-to-peer organisations. View their model.

Visceral Business work at the intersection of digital business modelling, change management and brand strategy. Created in 2008, they have worked with and advised organisations such as Macmillan Cancer Support, Thames Valley Housing, for whom they designed their Blueprint for Innovation, and many others on developing digital leadership and quantified organisation.

To learn more about ODI Cornwall visit their website.

Learning & Network node

Exantium is a leading UAE-based advisory firm focusing on the public sector transformation in the GCC and the Arab world, driven by cutting-edge innovations, strategic digital transformation initiatives and world-class informational policies.

To learn more about ODI Dubai visit their website.

Learning & Network node

Host organisation: eGov Unit, Insight Centre for Data Analytics, National University of Ireland, Galway

Our vision is to create a healthier, safer, more productive world by empowering a data-driven society to enable better decisions by individuals, communities, business and governments. The Insight Centre for Data Analytics was created to realise this vision. Insight is a joint initiative between University College Dublin, the National University of Ireland at Galway, University College Cork, and Dublin City University. Insight was established in 2013 by Science Foundation Ireland.

We combine the skills of leading researchers with cutting-edge technologies from diverse research areas. We work closely with industry partners to develop next-generation data acquisition and analytics solutions for important and diverse application areas.

The eGov unit based at Insight in Galway formerly known as DERI, won the contract to lead Ireland's Open Data Initiative with the Department of Public Expenditure and Reform (DPER). We developed a roadmap for Open Data in Ireland and established the national open data portal data.gov.ie. This is now managed by our spin-out company Derilinx.

As ODI Galway, we plan to deliver training courses for Open Data and provide support for the ODINE programme. We also aim to contribute to the Open Data community by holding public talks and networking events. We will make sure to engage with the wider open data community by supplying regular blogs and other forms of dissemination.

Get in touch with ODI Galway by visiting their website.
details.host: The Insight Centre for Data Analytics

details.description:
Network node

Big Apps West Sweden is a unique platform for developers, entrepreneurs, open data enthusiasts and designers among others to develop and market new apps and digital solutions.

To learn more about ODI Gothenburg visit their website.

Network node

The Southern Policy Centre is a think tank and policy forum for central Southern England. We focus on bringing together public policy makers with open data experts to shape new ideas for the region.

We aim to help Hampshire be a true hub for open data innovation, working together with the business community, the third sector, public services and with the general public.

To learn more about ODI Hampshire visit their website.

Pioneer node

Open Innovations Limited is an independent, non-profit, non-partisan company limited by guarantee.

The company holds the ODI Node Agreement for the region, as well as operating DataCity.

Learn more about ODI leeds by visiting their websites:

  • ODI Leeds

  • Datacity

The Ontology Engineering Group - Universidad Politécnica de Madrid, Madrid, Spain

Learning and Network node

Becoming a city node of the Open Data Institute is an opportunity to drive and share innovation in the region of Madrid and Spain around open data initiatives. We also aim at aligning open data in Spanish with similar European initiatives and disseminating successful Spanish initiatives worldwide through the ODI.

Our plans

Create learning, networking and market value through the execution of the following activities:

  1. Delivery of general and domain specific ODI training courses (in Spanish and English) on open data, with the relevant adaptations to the Spanish legislation.
  2. Engagement with the open data community by organising public talks and networking events (workshops, hackathons, datathons, etc.) in diverse application domains: smart cities, public administration, digital humanities, education, open science, and data journalism. We will open a regular blog for the community and will give support to other forms of dissemination.
  3. Delivery of ODI open data certificates to Spanish institutions using the ODI data certification scheme.
  4. Foster the creation of an ecosystem of stakeholders on the publication and consumption of open data in the region of Madrid.

Our expertise

We combine skills of leading researchers and innovators with cutting-edge technologies in the areas of open data, ontologies, Semantic Web and Linked Data, multilingualism, data journalism and e-science. We work closely with industry partners in diverse application domains that use open data: smart cities, public administrations, digital humanities, education, open science and data journalism.

Our existing catalogue of activities in open data includes:

  1. Training public and private institutions and Computer Science students on open data topics.
  2. Visit www.linkeddata.es to explore the major open data (and linked open data) initiatives, applications, websites and collaborations developed by us: the Spanish DBpedia chapter, open data developments for the City of Zaragoza; collecting vocabularies and ontologies about smart cities, energy and other related fields in the SmartCity catalogue; linked open data in the library domain with the Spanish National Library and in the geographical domain with the Spanish Geographical Institute; exposing language resources in the Linguistic Linked Open Data Cloud; and prototypes for an open bicycle sharing system.
  3. Active participation in international and national standardisation activities at W3C, ISO, OGC and AENOR.

To learn more about ODI Madrid visit their website.
details.excerpt: [The Ontology Engineering Group](http://www.oeg-upm.net/) - [Universidad Politécnica de Madrid](http://www.upm.es/), Madrid, Spain

details.description:
Learning node

The Greek Free/Open Source Software Society (GFOSS) is a non-profit organisation, which was founded in 2008 by Universities and Research Centers; today it consists of 29 Universities and Research Centers.

GFOSS's mission is focused on bridging the gap among research, policy (business and public) and implementation in the field of open, based on community-oriented initiatives.

Its activities are related to tools, partnerships and projects on open technologies and electronic governance and include actions at national and international level. Indicatively, GFOSS is involved in OGP, Web Index and Open Data Barometer, Open Budget Survey Tracker, FabLab and Harmonising Open Data in the Mediterranean.

To learn more about ODI Athens visit their website.

Learning & Network node

ODI Devon is hosted by Service Design agency Redfront, in partnership with Devon County Council. Our initial focus will be on building new partnerships around key strengths such as environment and climate data, but the Node will also be looking to develop new collaborations between rural and urban initiatives.

ODI Queensland's mission is to connect, equip and inspire Australians to innovate with data.

We do this by providing community events, training, resources and other services to help you publish and consume open data.

Open data is data that anyone can access, use and share. It can be used to create value, by:

  • improving government services and increasing transparency
  • empowering citizens to make more informed decisions
  • creating opportunities for innovation and job creation
  • solving public problems using data-driven analysis

We are a not-for-profit organisation funded by sponsors, supporters and members.

Find out more by visiting our website or come and meet us at one of our free events.
details.excerpt: ODI Queensland's mission is to connect, equip and inspire Australians to innovate with data.

details.description:
Learning & Network node

The Reference Centre for Entrepreneurial Intelligence (CRIE) is the lab for Entrepreneurship, Management and Innovation. It develops research, training and consulting projects in knowledge management, evaluation of intangible assets and digital environment.

CRIE belongs to the engineering program at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ), a Brazilian public and free university recognized by its high quality of teaching as well as by its commitment to research. The university has an active role in the development of science, technology and innovation in Brazil.

To learn more about ODI Rio visit their website.
details.host: Crie - Reference Centre for Entrepreneurial Intelligence

details.description:
Network node

Innovate! Osaka, an organization formed by Osaka City, drives and stimulates innovation in Osaka through workshops, lectures, hackathons and seminars. Becoming a city node of the Open Data Institute is an immense opportunity to create and share our work with the leading innovators of the world.

To learn more about ODI Osaka visit their website.

Community Node

Veracify provides data strategy, analytics and storytelling consulting services for businesses, not-for-profits and governments of all levels.

Our focus is to provide best of class data analytic services while helping clients navigate the ever-changing data governance landscape.

Veracify is proud to host the ODI Node Ottawa to help expand the publishing and use of Open Data in the local social innovation ecosystem. Click here to get an introduction to our philosophy.

To learn more about ODI Ottawa visit their website.

A learning and network node

Partner & Co. drive public and private sector ICT innovation across the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia by localising and delivering international knowledge and best practices that advance the future interests of our country and culture.

Our vision is to provide the essential capacity and expertise to ensure that open data is consistently available, used and advanced throughout Saudi's public and private sectors and is in alignment with related global initiatives

www.partner-co.co

Community Node

SciamLab is a fast-growing engineering company based in Rome specialized in modern data solutions and in business process optimization and automation.

The company is structured in three vertical units that tightly inter-operate to serve all-round products and superior services to the customers: DataLab is the data unit that released early in 2013 an innovative Content Discovery and Data Enrichment Platform based on BigData technologies that are today a foundation for several reference implementations in Italy.

OpenLab is the unit specialized on Public Sector Information that cooperating with the DataLab implemented most of the transparency initiatives of the Italian government in 2014-2016.

SmartLab is an unit that invested mainly in R&D activities for the deployment and management of data intensive sensor networks to Advanced Data Stream Analysis.

To learn more about ODI Rome visit their website.

Network node

Becoming an ODI Node and working with world class experts will enable Saltlux to fulfill its mission of helping people in ‘communicating knowledge’. It will also support our involvement in 'Government 3.0', a national project in Korea which aims to open and utilize government data.

Learning & Network node

ODI Toronto is a national non-profit run by volunteers. The vision is to make open data consistently available throughout Canada and to support related global initiatives.

To learn more about ODI Toronto visit their website.

Learning node

The Fondazione Bruno Kessler’s Center for Information and Communication Technology (FBK-ICT Center), founded in the second half of 1980s, is an international research center that focuses on high quality research of Information Technology, in order to provide a practical and experimental evidence of its added value for the market, cultural growth, and social welfare.

FBK-ICT IRST aims to develop ICT for improving the quality of life, by advancing ICT focused on the individual.

These goals position FBK ICT - IRST in the international scientific arena as a unique institution, which differs from universities, primarily devoted to theoretical speculation, as well as from applied research centers, primarily devoted to technology transfer.

To learn more about ODI Trento visit their website.

Network node

Semantic Web Company is a technology provider assisting organisations in improving their information management. Based in Vienna, the company supports organisations worldwide to extract knowledge from the big data from within their company, publish data and improve communication between knowledge workers by using social software and semantic technologies.

To learn more about ODI Vienna visit their website.
